page.title: 03Housing in Western Enfield
page.content: The council owns approximately 8000 flats,houses and bungalows in the Western part of Enfield.The rapid spread of housing did not continue after the Second World War,owing to the existence of more effective planning controls and the Metropolitan Green Belt. We did a housing survey and found that in the Cockfosters,Oakwood and Grange Park areas the housing is mainly semi-detached.Near Cockfosters staion there are many maisonettes. There is also a council Estate at Coverack Close on which there is terraced housing and high rise flats. In Grange Park there are a few terraces,maisonettes and detached houses. In the Ridgeway area there are more semi-detached houses than else where.
